arm_group.description: It's a single arm. Intervention as described in the detailed description.

brief_summary.textblock:
The objectives of this study is to investigate if pre-treating the skin with an ablative
      fractional laser that creates small micropores in the skin:

        1. Increases the uptake of Methylaminolevulinat (MAL) in the skin.

        2. Decreases the required incubation time of MAL when performing photo dynamic therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing Uptake of Methylaminolevulinat With Fractional Ablative Laser Technique

detailed_description.textblock:
12 healthy male individuals were included.

      On the back, 25 areas measuring 2.8x2.8 cm were marked, plus one control area. We tested 2
      variables.

      1) Density of laser channels. 2) Methylaminolevulinat (MAL) concentration

        1. Laser - Each area was randomized to receiving:

             -  no treatment

             -  1% laser channel density

             -  2% laser channel density

             -  5% laser channel density

             -  10% laser channel density

             -  15% laser channel density

        2. MAL - Each density was assigned to 4 areas. Within each density category, the four
           areas were randomized to receive:

             -  vehicle

             -  4% MAL

             -  8%MAL

             -  16%MAL

      The uptake of MAL was evaluated by fluorescence intensity measured with a florescence camera
      at t=

        -  0min

        -  30min

        -  1h

        -  1.5h 2h 2.5h 3h

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male

          -  >18 years old

          -  Fitzpatrick skin type I-III

          -  No UV exposure thee months prior to study

          -  Signed study consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known allergy to substances in MAL or Unguentum M cream.

          -  Previous keloid

          -  Use of topical or systemic photosensitizing drug

          -  Evaluated to not be able to follow treatment protocol

intervention.description: It's a single arm study. Intervention as described in detailed description.

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The National Committee on Health Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: Fluorescence Intensity measured with a fluorescence camera.
